name: Avoid including files other than header files
description:
This rule searches for C/C++ files that include files other than header files (with file extensions like ".h", etc). The extension list is a parameter and can be changed at will. 

Note: Including files without extensions is not considered as being problematic.
output:
Associated to each implementation file with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The Include name
rationale:
If a file includes a file that does not have a header extension this either means:
- That naming conventions have not been respected, therefore making it harder to understand the program etc.
- That code is duplicated at several locations breaking the encapsulation rules
remediation: Either rename the included file (and where it is referenced) or review.
alternativeName: Avoid including files other than header files
